name: National Geographic Digital Motion
overview: National Geographic Digital Motion (formerly National Geographic Film Library) is the stock footage service of National Geographic Digital Media. This service licenses the Emmy Award-winning National Geographic Television and film programming. In addition, National Geographic Digital Motion agents represent peer-level archives, including Australian Broadcasting Corporation, INA of France, National Film Board of Canada, the White House Historical Association, ZDF Enterprises of Germany and the World Bank, in select territories around the world. The collection consists of amazing footage from around the world, captured by talented and adventurous filmmakers who are willing to endure Earthâ€™s harshest extremes for never-before-seen images. The National Geographic Digital Motion digital archive is filled with unparalleled visuals: not only nature and wildlife, but also people and cultures, history and archaeology, adventure and exploration, news and current events, and the world around us. For more information on National Geographic Digital Motionâ€™s video archive database and to license clips, visit www.ngdigitalmotion.com or call +1 720.212.0820.
